Description: Green glass spindle-whorl, bead or button; circular disc with a slightly conical section, flattened on top; central vertical perforation; made by trailing, possibly around a rod; underside is damaged, probably in antiquity as the iridescence has formed over the damaged area.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Horatio Herbert Kitchener, Earl Kitchener of Khartoum
Curator's comments: See Bailey, Op. Ath. VI (1965), pp. 5-13 for details of the Hake-Kitchener excavations at Kourion.
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
